name: fortinet-fortiedr
label: Fortinet FortiEDR
description: FortiEDR protects endpoints pre and post infection, stopping data breaches in real-time and automatically orchestrating incident investigation and response. This connector facilitates the automated operations related to events, forensics and collectors.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL of the Fortinet FortiEDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: Username
fields.description: Username that contains a Rest API role and using which you will access the Fortinet FortiEDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: username

fields.title: Password
fields.description: Password used to access the FortiEDR server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: password

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the Fortinet FortiEDR is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Get Event by ID
operations.description: Retrieves a specific event from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the event ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.description: ID of the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Note: You can get event IDs using the "Get Events" action.

operations.title: Get Events
operations.description: Retrieves all the events from Fortinet FortiEDR that match the condition(s) you have specified. Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

parameters.title: Event IDs
parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.tooltip: The list of event IDs separated by comma.
parameters.description: List of event IDs based on which you want to retrieve events from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device
parameters.tooltip: The device name where the events occurred.
parameters.description: Name of the device on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector groups whose collector reported the events.
parameters.description: List of collector groups whose collector had reported the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Operating System
parameters.name: operatingSystems
parameters.description: Name of the operating system of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Device IPs
parameters.name: deviceIps
parameters.tooltip: The IPs of the devices where the event occurred.
parameters.description: List of IP addresses of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: MAC Addresses
parameters.name: macAddresses
parameters.tooltip: The MAC addresses where the event occurred.
parameters.description: MAC addresses where the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: fileHash
parameters.tooltip: The hash signature of the main process of the event.
parameters.description: Hash signature of the main process of the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process
parameters.name: process
parameters.description: Name of the main process of the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process Path
parameters.name: paths
parameters.tooltip: The path of the processes related to the event.
parameters.description: Path of the processes related to the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: First Seen From
parameters.name: firstSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: First Seen To
parameters.name: firstSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: "To" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen From
parameters.name: lastSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen To
parameters.name: lastSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Classification
parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: Classification of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Classification is a list of strings that contain one or more of the following values: Malicious, Suspicious, Inconclusive, Likely Safe, PUP, or Safe.

parameters.title: Actions
parameters.name: actions
parameters.tooltip: The action that was enforced.
parameters.description: Actions that were enforced on the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose from the following options: Block, Simulation Block, or Log.

parameters.title: Destinations
parameters.name: destinations
parameters.tooltip: The connection destination(s) of the events.
parameters.description: Connection destination(s) of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Rule
parameters.name: rule
parameters.tooltip: The short rule name of the rule that triggered the events.
parameters.description: Short rule name of the rule that triggered the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Logged in User
parameters.name: loggedUser
parameters.description: Logged-in user associated with the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Seen
parameters.name: seen
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were read/unread.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were read/unread by the user operating the API.

parameters.title: Handled
parameters.name: handled
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were handled/unhandled.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were handled/unhandled.

parameters.title: Signed
parameters.name: signed
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether the event is signed.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR is signed/unsigned.

parameters.title: Muted
parameters.name: muted
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether the event is muted.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR is muted/unmuted.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description: Name of a specific organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Name of the organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the enSilo system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies.If you choose Exact organization name, then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: Archived
parameters.name: archived
parameters.tooltip: Enable to include only archived events.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether to include only archived events while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Strict Mode
parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.tooltip: Enable to perform strict matching on the search parameters.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.title: Items Per Page
parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum value is 2,000.
parameters.description: Maximum number of events that this operation should return for the current page. Values supported are: Default "100" and Maximum "2000".

parameters.title: Sorting
parameters.name: sorting
parameters.tooltip: {"lastSeen": true, "firstSeen": false } True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.
parameters.description: Name of the fields by which you want to sort the results retrieved by this operation. You can enter the fields in the following format: {"column1":true, "column2":false}. True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.

operations.title: Update Events
operations.description:
Updates events in Fortinet FortiEDR that match the condition(s) you have specified. 
Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

parameters.title: Field to Update on Event
parameters.name: update_fields
parameters.tooltip: Please select only one field to update as multiple updates are not allowed.
parameters.description: Specify the one field to update as multiple updates are not allowed.

Read.title: Mark as Read
Read.name: read
Read.tooltip: A true/false parameter that marks the events as read/unread.
Read.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to mark as read/unread in Fortinet FortiEDR.

Handle.title: Mark as Handled
Handle.name: handle
Handle.tooltip: A true/false parameter that indicates whether the events were handled/unhandled.
Handle.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to mark as handled/unhandled in Fortinet FortiEDR.

Handle.title: Add Comment
Handle.name: comment
Handle.tooltip: Free text to be added as a comment to the event. The event must be handled in order to accept comments.
Handle.description: Free text to be added as a comment to the event. The event must be handled in order to accept comments (supported for version 2.6.4 and above).

Archive.title: Archive Event
Archive.name: archive
Archive.tooltip: A true/false parameter indicating whether to hide/unhide the events.
Archive.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to mark as hide/unhide in Fortinet FortiEDR.

Classification.title: Classify Event
Classification.name: classification
Classification.tooltip: Classify event using one of the provided value.
Classification.description: Classify event with one of the following values: Malicious, PUP or Safe (supported in V2.7.3 and above).

Classification.title: Add Comment
Classification.name: comment
Classification.tooltip: Free text to be added as a comment to the event. The event must be handled in order to accept comments.
Classification.description: Free text to be added as a comment to the event. The event must be handled in order to accept comments (supported for version 2.6.4 and above).

Mute.title: Mute Event

True.title: Mute Duration
True.name: muteDuration
True.tooltip: Mute event for specific duration using one of the provided value.
True.description: Specifies the mute duration time. Allowed values are Week, Month, Year or Permanently.

False.title: Forced to Unmute an Event
False.name: forceUnmute
False.tooltip: To force an archive event when the event is muted.
False.description: Indicates whether to force an archive event when the event is muted.

Mute.name: mute
Mute.tooltip: A true/false parameter indicating whether to mute events
Mute.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to mark as mute/unmute in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Event IDs
parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.tooltip: The list of event IDs separated by comma.
parameters.description: List of event IDs based on which you want to update events in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device
parameters.tooltip: The device name where the events occurred.
parameters.description: Name of the device on which the events occurred that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2

parameters.description: List of collector groups whose collector had reported the events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.description: List of IP addresses of the devices on which the events occurred that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.tooltip: The hash signature of the main process of the event.
parameters.description: Hash signature of the main process of the event that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.name: process
parameters.description: Name of the main process of the event that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process Path
parameters.name: paths
parameters.tooltip: The path of the processes related to the event.
parameters.description: Path of the processes related to the event that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.name: firstSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: First Seen To
parameters.name: firstSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: "To" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen From
parameters.name: lastSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen To
parameters.name: lastSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Seen
parameters.name: seen
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were read/unread.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR were read/unread by the user operating the API.

parameters.title: Handled
parameters.name: handled
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were handled/unhandled.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR were handled/unhandled.

parameters.title: Severities
parameters.name: severities
parameters.tooltip: A severity value for filter to match.
parameters.description: A severity value for the filter to match. An option with one of the following values: Critical, High, or Medium.

parameters.title: Destinations
parameters.name: destinations
parameters.tooltip: The connection destination(s) of the events.
parameters.description: Connection destination(s) of the events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Actions
parameters.name: actions
parameters.tooltip: The action that was enforced.
parameters.description: Actions that were enforced on the events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose from the following options: Block, Simulation Block, or Log.

parameters.title: Rule
parameters.name: rule
parameters.tooltip: The short rule name of the rule that triggered the events.
parameters.description: Short rule name of the rule that triggered the events that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Strict Mode
parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.tooltip: Enable to perform strict matching on the search parameters.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Classification
parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: Classification of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Classification is a list of strings that contain one or more of the following values: Malicious, Suspicious, Inconclusive, Likely Safe, PUP, or Safe.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description: Name of a specific organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.description: Name of the organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the enSilo system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies.If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: Muted
parameters.name: muted
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether the event is muted.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR is muted/unmuted.

operations.title: Get Raw Data Items
operations.description: Retrieves the raw data items from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the event ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.name: eventId
parameters.description: ID of the event that holds the raw data items that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device
parameters.tooltip: The device name where the raw event occurred.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the device on which the raw event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector groups whose collector reported the events.
parameters.description: (Optional) List of collector groups whose collector had reported the raw events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: First Seen From
parameters.name: firstSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: (Optional) "From" date when the raw event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: First Seen To
parameters.name: firstSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: "To" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range
parameters.description: (Optional) "To" date when the raw event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen From
parameters.name: lastSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "from" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: Specifies the "from" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen To
parameters.name: lastSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: (Optional) "To" date when the raw event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Strict Mode
parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.tooltip: Enable to perform strict matching on the search parameters.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Full Data Requested
parameters.name: fullDataRequested
parameters.tooltip: Enable to include the event internal information.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether to include the event internal information for the raw events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: (Optional) Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.title: Items Per Page
parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum value is 2,000.
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of events that this operation should return for the current page. Values supported are: Default "100" and Maximum "2000".

parameters.title: Sorting
parameters.name: sorting
parameters.tooltip: {"lastSeen": true, "firstSeen": false } True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the fields by which you want to sort the results retrieved by this operation. You can enter the fields in the following format: {"column1":true, "column2":false}. True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.

operations.title: Get Event Count
operations.description: Retrieves the event count from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the filter parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event IDs
parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.tooltip: List of event IDs separated by comma.
parameters.description: List of comma-separated event IDs based on which you want to retrieve event counts from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device
parameters.tooltip: The device name where the events occurred.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the device on which the event whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector groups whose collector reported the events.
parameters.description: (Optional) List of collector groups whose collector had reported the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Operating System
parameters.name: operatingSystems
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the operating system of the devices on which the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Device IPs
parameters.name: deviceIps
parameters.tooltip: The IPs of the devices where the event occurred.
parameters.description: (Optional) List of IP addresses of the devices on which the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: MAC Addresses
parameters.name: macAddresses
parameters.tooltip: The MAC addresses where the event occurred.
parameters.description: (Optional) MAC addresses where the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: fileHash
parameters.tooltip: The hash signature of the main process of the event.
parameters.description: (Optional) Hash signature of the main process of the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process
parameters.name: process
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the main process of the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process Path
parameters.name: paths
parameters.tooltip: The path of the processes related to the event.
parameters.description: (Optional) Path of the processes related to the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: First Seen From
parameters.name: firstSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: (Optional) "From" date when the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: First Seen To
parameters.name: firstSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range
parameters.description: (Optional) "To" date when the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen From
parameters.name: lastSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "from" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: (Optional) "From" date when the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen To
parameters.name: lastSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: (Optional) "To" date when the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Classification
parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: Classification of the events whose counts you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Classification is a list of strings that contain one or more of the following values: Malicious, Suspicious, Inconclusive, Likely Safe, PUP, or Safe.

parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving event counts from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: (Optional) Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.title: Items Per Page
parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum value is 2,000.
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of events that this operation should return for the current page. Values supported are: Default "100" and Maximum "2000".

parameters.title: Sorting
parameters.name: sorting
parameters.tooltip: {"lastSeen": true, "firstSeen": false } True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.
parameters.description: Name of the fields by which you want to sort the results retrieved by this operation. You can enter the fields in the following format: {"column1":true, "column2":false}. True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.

operations.title: Get Event List Extended
operations.description:
Retrieves archived/unarchived events together from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the filter parameters you have specified. 
Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

parameters.title: Event IDs
parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.tooltip: The list of event IDs separated by comma.
parameters.description: List of event IDs based on which you want to retrieve events from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Device Name
parameters.name: device
parameters.tooltip: The device name where the events occurred.
parameters.description: Name of the device on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector groups whose collector reported the events.
parameters.description: List of collector groups whose collector had reported the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Operating System
parameters.name: operatingSystems
parameters.description: Name of the operating system of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Device IPs
parameters.name: deviceIps
parameters.tooltip: The IPs of the devices where the event occurred.
parameters.description: List of IP addresses of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: MAC Addresses
parameters.name: macAddresses
parameters.tooltip: The MAC addresses where the event occurred.
parameters.description: MAC addresses where the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: fileHash
parameters.tooltip: The hash signature of the main process of the event.
parameters.description: Hash signature of the main process of the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process
parameters.name: process
parameters.description: Name of the main process of the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Process Path
parameters.name: paths
parameters.tooltip: The path of the processes related to the event.
parameters.description: Path of the processes related to the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: First Seen From
parameters.name: firstSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: First Seen To
parameters.name: firstSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: "To" date when the event was first seen. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the first time. Use this parameter together with the "First Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen From
parameters.name: lastSeenFrom
parameters.tooltip: "From" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "From" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen To" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Last Seen To
parameters.name: lastSeenTo
parameters.tooltip: Specifies the "to" date when the event was last seen. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.
parameters.description: "To" date when the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR, was seen for the last time. Use this parameter together with the "Last Seen From" parameter to specify a date range.

parameters.title: Classification
parameters.name: classifications
parameters.description: Classification of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Classification is a list of strings that contain one or more of the following values: Malicious, Suspicious, Inconclusive, Likely Safe, PUP, or Safe.

parameters.title: Actions
parameters.name: actions
parameters.tooltip: The action that was enforced.
parameters.description: Actions that were enforced on the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose from the following options: Block, Simulation Block, or Log.

parameters.title: Destinations
parameters.name: destinations
parameters.tooltip: The connection destination(s) of the events.
parameters.description: Connection destination(s) of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Rule
parameters.name: rule
parameters.tooltip: The short rule name of the rule that triggered the events.
parameters.description: Short rule name of the rule that triggered the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Logged in User
parameters.name: loggedUser
parameters.description: Logged-in user associated with the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Seen
parameters.name: seen
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were read/unread.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were read/unread by the user operating the API.

parameters.title: Handled
parameters.name: handled
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether events were handled/unhandled.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were handled/unhandled.

parameters.title: Signed
parameters.name: signed
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether the event is signed.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR is signed/unsigned.

parameters.title: Muted
parameters.name: muted
parameters.tooltip: True/False parameter indicating whether the event is muted.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether the event that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR is muted/unmuted.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description: Name of a specific organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Name of the organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the enSilo system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies.If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: Strict Mode
parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.tooltip: Enable to perform strict matching on the search parameters.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.title: Items Per Page
parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum value is 2,000.
parameters.description: Maximum number of events that this operation should return for the current page. Values supported are: Default "100" and Maximum "2000".

parameters.title: Sorting
parameters.name: sorting
parameters.tooltip: {"lastSeen": true, "firstSeen": false } True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.
parameters.description: Name of the fields by which you want to sort the results retrieved by this operation. You can enter the fields in the following format: {"column1":true, "column2":false}. True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.

operations.title: Search Filehash
operations.description: Searches a file hash among the current events, threat hunting repository, and communicating applications that exist in the Fortinet FortiEDR system.

parameters.title: Filehash
parameters.name: fileHashes
parameters.tooltip: The list of hashes separated by commas.
parameters.description: One or more comma-separated file hashes that you want to search for in Fortinet FortiEDR.

operations.title: Get File
operations.description: Retrieves a specific file from the specified device from Fortinet FortiEDR, based on the device type, device name/ID, and file paths you have specified, and adds it as an attachment in CyOPs™

parameters.title: Type

ID.title: Device ID
ID.name: device
ID.description: ID of the device from which you want to retrieve the file.

Name.title: Device Name
Name.name: device
Name.description: Name of the device from which you want to retrieve the file.

parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: The type of the device input parameter.
parameters.description: Type of the device input parameter from which you want to get the file from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose between ID or Name.If you choose 'ID', then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: File Paths
parameters.name: filePaths
parameters.description: List of file paths from which you want to retrieve the file. For example, c:\temp\example.exe

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.name: organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of a specific organization whose associated files you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.

operations.title: Retrieve File or Memory
operations.description: Retrieves a file or memory related to a specific event from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the raw event ID and other input parameters you have specified and adds it as an attachment in CyOPs™.

parameters.title: Raw Event ID
parameters.name: rawEventId
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the raw event on which to perform the memory retrieval.
parameters.description: ID of the raw event on which you want to perform the memory retrieval in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Retrieve From
parameters.name: retrieve_from
parameters.description: (Optional) Choose whether to retrieve the memory from Memory, Disk.

Disk.title: File Paths
Disk.name: filePaths
Disk.tooltip: The list of file paths separated by comma.
Disk.description: (Optional) List of file paths from which you want to perform the memory retrieval in Fortinet FortiEDR.

Memory.title: Process ID
Memory.name: processId
Memory.tooltip: the ID of the process from which to take a memory image.
Memory.description: (Optional) ID of the process from which you want to take a memory image.

Memory.title: Memory Region Start Address
Memory.name: startRange
Memory.tooltip: The memory start range, in Hexadecimal format
Memory.description: (Optional) Memory start range, in Hexadecimal format from which you want to take a memory image.

Memory.title: Memory Region End Address
Memory.name: endRange
Memory.tooltip: The memory end range, in Hexadecimal format.
Memory.description: (Optional) Memory end range, in Hexadecimal format from which you want to take a memory image.

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.name: organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of a specific organization on which you want to perform the memory retrieval in Fortinet FortiEDR. Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.

operations.title: Remediate Device
operations.description: Takes remediation actions on Fortinet FortiEDR such as killing a process, deleting a file and/or cleaning persistent data on which malware was detected based on the device type, device name/ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Type

ID.title: Device ID
ID.name: deviceId
ID.description: ID of the device on which you want to take the remediation action.

Name.title: Device Name
Name.name: device
Name.description: Name of the device on which you want to take the remediation action.

parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: The type of the device input parameter.
parameters.description: Type of the device input parameter on which you want to perform the remediation action in Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose between ID or Name.If you choose 'ID', then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.name: organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of a specific organization that contains the device on which you want to perform the remediation action.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Remediation Action
parameters.name: remediate_action
parameters.tooltip: Select one of the Remediation Action.
parameters.description: Select one of the Remediation Action.

Kill Process.title: Process ID
Kill Process.name: terminatedProcessId
Kill Process.tooltip: The process ID to terminate on the device.
Kill Process.description: Process ID that you want to terminate on the specified device.

Kill Process.title: Process Name
Kill Process.name: processName
Kill Process.description: Name of the process on which you want to take remediation action.

Delete File.title: Delete File at Path
Delete File.name: executablesToRemove
Delete File.tooltip: The list of full paths of executable files separated by comma. This param is compulsory if you want to delete file from device.
Delete File.description: List of full paths of executable files (*.exe) that you want to delete on the specified device.

Handle Persistent Data.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Action

Delete Key.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Path
Delete Key.name: persistenceDataPath
Delete Key.description: Path of the persistent data on the specified device.

Delete Key.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Value Name
Delete Key.name: persistenceDataValueName
Delete Key.description: Value name of the persistent data on the specified device.

Delete Value.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Path
Delete Value.name: persistenceDataPath
Delete Value.description: Path of the persistent data on the specified device.

Delete Value.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Value Name
Delete Value.name: persistenceDataValueName
Delete Value.description: Value name of the persistent data on the specified device.

Update.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Path
Update.name: persistenceDataPath
Update.description: Path of the persistent data on the specified device.

Update.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Value Name
Update.name: persistenceDataValueName
Update.description: Value name of the persistent data on the specified device.

Update.title: Persistence Data (Registry) Value New Type
Update.name: persistenceDataValueNewType
Update.description: New data value type that should be applied to the persistent data on the specified device. You can choose from the following options: REG_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_BINARY, REG_DWORD, REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN, REG_LINK, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_RESOURCE_LIST, REG_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR, REG_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST or REG_QWORD.threadId: Specifies the thread ID.

Update.title: Persistence Data (Registry) New Content
Update.name: persistenceDataNewContent
Update.description: Specifies the persistent data new content. The content format provided depends on the type used in persistenceDataValueNewType. The format should be provided as follows: String for the following types: REG_SZ(1), REG_EXPAND_SZ(2), REG_DWORD(4) and REG_QWORD(11). Base64 for the following types: REG_BINARY(3), REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN(5), REG_LINK(6), REG_MULTI_SZ(7), REG_RESOURCE_LIST(8), REG_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR(9) and REG_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST(10).

Handle Persistent Data.name: persistenceDataAction
Handle Persistent Data.description: Action that should be taken for persistent data on the specified device. You can choose from the following options: DeleteKey, DeleteValue, or Update.

Remediate Thread.title: Thread ID
Remediate Thread.name: threadId
Remediate Thread.tooltip: ID of the thread on which you want to take remediation action.
Remediate Thread.description: ID of the thread on which you want to take the remediation action.

operations.title: Get Collector List
operations.description: Retrieves the list of the collectors from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the device type, device name/ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Type

ID.title: Device IDs
ID.name: devicesIds
ID.tooltip: The list of device IDs separated by comma.
ID.description: ID of the device from which you want to retrieve the collector list.

Name.title: Device Names
Name.name: devices
Name.tooltip: The list of device names separated by comma.
Name.description: ID of the device from which you want to retrieve the collector list.

parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: The type of the device input parameter.
parameters.description: Type of the device input parameter from which you want to get the collector from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose between ID or Name.If you choose 'ID', then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector group names separated by comma.
parameters.placeholder: e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2
parameters.description: (Optional) List of collector group names whose associated collectors you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: IPs
parameters.name: ips
parameters.description: (Optional) List of IP addresses whose associated collectors you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Operating Systems
parameters.name: operatingSystems
parameters.description: (Optional) List of operating systems whose associated collectors you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. For example, Windows 7 Pro.

parameters.title: OS Families
parameters.name: osFamilies
parameters.placeholder: e.g Windows, Windows Server, OS X.
parameters.description: (Optional) List of OS Families whose associated collectors you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. e.g Windows, Windows Server, OS X.

parameters.title: States
parameters.name: states
parameters.description: (Optional) List of collector states based on which you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose on or more of the following options: Running, Disconnected, Disabled, Degraded, RebootPending, Isolated, Expired, or PendingMigration.

parameters.title: Last Seen Start
parameters.name: lastSeenStart
parameters.tooltip: Retrieves collectors that were last seen after the value assigned to this date
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieves collectors from Fortinet FortiEDR that were last seen after the value assigned to this date.

parameters.title: Last Seen End
parameters.name: lastSeenEnd
parameters.tooltip: Retrieve collectors that were last seen before the value assigned to this date.
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve collectors from Fortinet FortiEDR that were last seen before the value assigned to this date.

parameters.title: Versions
parameters.name: versions
parameters.tooltip: The list of collector versions separated by comma.
parameters.description: (Optional) List of collector versions that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Strict Mode
parameters.name: strictMode
parameters.tooltip: Enable to perform strict matching on the search parameters.
parameters.description: (Optional) True/False parameter indicating whether or not to perform strict matching on the search parameters while retrieving event counts from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false.

parameters.title: Show Expired
parameters.name: showExpired
parameters.tooltip: A True/False parameter indicating whether to show an expired collector.
parameters.description: True/False parameter indicating whether to show an expired collector in the results retrieved from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Logged in User
parameters.name: loggedUser
parameters.description: (Optional) Logged-in user associated with the collectors you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description: Specifies the name of a specific organization. The value that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Specifies the organization. The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, as described below, determines to which organization(s) an operation applies.

parameters.title: Page Number
parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: (Optional) Page number from which you want to retrieve records.

parameters.title: Items Per Page
parameters.name: itemsPerPage
parameters.tooltip: The maximum value is 2,000.
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of events that this operation should return for the current page. Values supported are: Default "100" and Maximum "2000".

parameters.title: Sorting
parameters.name: sorting
parameters.tooltip: {"lastSeenTime": true} True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.
parameters.description: Name of the fields by which you want to sort the results retrieved by this operation. You can enter the fields in the following format:{"column1":true, "column2":false}. True indicates to sort in descending order. Results are sorted by the first field, then by the second field and so on.

parameters.title: Organization

ID.title: Device IDs

operations.title: Create Exception
operations.description: Creates an IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR using the set of IP addresses and other parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the event ID that needs to be added as an exception in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: eventId

parameters.title: Collector Groups
parameters.name: collectorGroups
parameters.description: Specify the list of all the collector groups to which the exception should be applied. If you do not specify any collector groups, then, all collector groups are selected.

parameters.title: All Collector Groups
parameters.name: allCollectorGroups
parameters.tooltip: Disable to not to applied for all collector groups.
parameters.description: Select True for this parameter to apply the exception to all collector groups. When this parameter is not used, then all collector groups are selected.

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description: Specifies the name of a specific organization. The value that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.name: organization

parameters.title: All Organizations
parameters.name: allOrganizations
parameters.tooltip: Disable to not to applied for all organisations.
parameters.description: Select True for this parameter to apply the exception to all organizations. When this parameter is not used, then all organizations are selected.

parameters.title: Destinations
parameters.name: destinations
parameters.description: List of IP addresses to which the exception applies and/or the value of the internal destinations.

parameters.title: All Destinations
parameters.name: allDestinations
parameters.tooltip: Disable to not to applied for all destinations.
parameters.description: Select True for this parameter to apply the exception to all destinations. When this parameter is not used, then all destinations are selected.

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: User-defined string that you want to attach to the exception in Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Force Create
parameters.name: forceCreate
parameters.tooltip: Select True for this parameter to apply to create the exception, even if there are already exceptions that cover the specified event.
parameters.description: Select True for this parameter to apply to create the exception, even if there are already exceptions that cover the specified event.

parameters.title: Exception JSON Values
parameters.name: exceptionJson
parameters.tooltip: e.g {"useInException" : { "wildfire-test-pe-file.exe" : { "Unconfirmed File Detectedupdate" : true, "Unmapped Executable" : false} }}

operations.title: Get Exception List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of IPSets from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the IP address and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Created Before
parameters.description: DateTime before which the exceptions that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were created.
parameters.name: createdBefore

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: DateTime after which the exceptions that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were created.

parameters.title: Updated Before

parameters.title: Updated After
parameters.description: DateTime after which the exceptions that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were updated.
parameters.name: updatedAfter

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description:
Name of a specific organization whose associated event exceptions you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR. 

If you choose All Organizations, then this operation will retrieve data that is shared by all organizations.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
Name of the organization whose associated event exceptions you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies. 
If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

operations.title: Update Exception
operations.description: Updates IP addresses in the specific IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR using the set of IP addresses, the IPSet name, and other parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: Event ID whose associated exception you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: eventId

parameters.title: Exception ID
parameters.description: ID of the exception that you want to update in the Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: exceptionId

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description:
SName of a specific organization that you want to update in the specific exception Fortinet FortiEDR.  
Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: organization

parameters.title: Add Destinations

Exact Destinations.title: Exact Destinations (IP Set Names)
Exact Destinations.placeholder: IP set names to add into the exception. Specify in CSV format.
Exact Destinations.description:
If you choose 'Exact Destination', then in the Exact Destinations (IP Set Names) field, specify the destination names, in the CSV format that you want to add to the specified exception. 

If you choose 'All Destinations', then the Destination parameter will be set automatically to 'All Destinations'.
Exact Destinations.name: ip_set_name

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of destination that you want to update in the specific exception Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose between Exact Destination or All Destinations.

parameters.title: Collector Group

Exact Collector Group.title: Exact Collector Group
Exact Collector Group.placeholder: Collector group names to add into the exception. Specify in CSV format.
Exact Collector Group.description: Specify the collector group names to add into the exception. Specify in CSV format.
Exact Collector Group.name: collector_group

parameters.name: collector_grp
parameters.tooltip: If All Organizations option is selected then Destination parameter will be set to All Destination value automatically.
parameters.description: Specify the collector group names to add into the exception. Specify in CSV format. Note: If All Organizations option is selected then Destination parameter will be set to All Destination value automatically.

parameters.title: Add Comment
parameters.description: Provide comment sentence to add.
parameters.name: comment

operations.title: Get Event Exceptions
operations.description: Retrieves the list of event exceptions from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the event ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the event whose associated exceptions you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: eventId

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description:
(Optional) Name of a specific organization whose associated event exceptions you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note:The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: organization

operations.title: Get Raw JSON Event Data
operations.description: Retrieve the raw data of event based on the event ID.

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: ID of the event that holds the raw JSON data that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: rawItemIds

parameters.title: Organization
parameters.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
parameters.description:
(Optional) Name of a specific organization whose associated events hold the raw JSON data that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note:The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: organization

operations.title: Create IPSet
operations.description: Creates an IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR using the set of IP addresses and other parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description: Name of a specific organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
Name of the organization in which you want to create the IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR. 
The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies. 
If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: IP Set Name
parameters.description: Name of the IPSet you want to create in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: name

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: Description of the IPSet you want to create in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: description

parameters.title: IP Address to Include
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of IP addresses to include.
parameters.description: List of IP addresses to include in the IPSet you want to create in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: include

parameters.title: IP Address to Exclude
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of IP addresses to exclude.
parameters.description: List of IP Addresses to exclude from the IPSet you want to create in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: exclude

operations.title: Get IPSet List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of IPSets from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the IP address and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: IP to Search
parameters.description: IP address using which you want to search for IPSets in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: ip

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description:
Name of a specific organization whose associated IPSets you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR. 

If you choose All organizations, then this operation will retrieve data that is shared by all organizations.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
Name of the organization whose associated IPSets you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. 
The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies. 
If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

operations.title: Update IPSet
operations.description: Updates IP addresses in the specific IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR using the set of IP addresses, the IPSet name, and other parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description:
Organization Name: Name of a specific organization in which you want to update the IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR. 

If you choose All Organizations, then the Organization parameter will be set automatically to 'All Organizations'. If you choose Each, the operation applies independently to each organization.  

For example,let's assume that the same user exists in multiple organizations. When each is specified in the organization parameter, then each organization can update this user separately.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
Name of the organization in which you want to update the IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR. 
The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies. 
If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

parameters.title: IP Set Name
parameters.description: Name of the IPSet you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: name

parameters.title: Description
parameters.description: Description of the IPSet you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: description

parameters.title: Add IP into Sets
parameters.description: Specifies whether the IP needs to add or remove into the IP Sets Include/Exclude sections. If checkbox is selected then it will add else remove IPs.
parameters.name: add_items
parameters.tooltip: Select this checkbox to add the IP address to the IPSets Include/Exclude sections. Clear this checkbox to remove the IP address from the IPSets Include/Exclude sections.

parameters.title: IP Address to Include
parameters.description: List of IP Addresses to include from the IPSet you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of IP addresses to include.
parameters.name: include

parameters.title: IP Address to Exclude
parameters.tooltip: Comma-separated list of IP addresses to exclude.
parameters.description: List of IP Addresses to exclude from the IPSet you want to update in Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: exclude

operations.title: Delete IPSet
operations.description: Deletes specific IPSets from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the IPSet names and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: IP Set Names
parameters.description: List of the IPSet names that you want to delete from Fortinet FortiEDR.
parameters.name: ipSets

parameters.title: Organization

Exact Organization Name.title: Organization Name
Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.
Exact Organization Name.description:
Name of a specific organization from which you want to delete the IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR. 
Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR. 

If you choose All Organizations, then the Organization parameter will be set automatically to 'All Organizations'.
Exact Organization Name.name: org_name

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description:
(Optional) Name of the organization from which you want to delete the IPSet in Fortinet FortiEDR. 
The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the FortiEDR system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies. 
If you choose Exact Organization Name, then you must specify the following parameter:

Exact Organization Name.placeholder: The org name that you specify here must match exactly.

Name of a specific organization whose associated environment summary you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.

parameters.title: Add License Blob
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to 'true' to the license blob to the response retrieved by this operation. By default, addLicenseBlob is set to 'false'.
parameters.name: addLicenseBlob
